summary: a pleasant scheme for long vimming sessions
name: manxome-foes-colorscheme
description: The colorschemes that ship with vim all made me wince, and after several hours of editing, even the most innocuous of them would become unpleasant.  I designed this scheme to be both clearly marked up and easy on my eyes.  It reminds me of the default colorscheme of the Telegard BBS.
install_details: Drop it in ~/.vim/colors and add "colorscheme manxome" to your vimrc, and you&#039re done!  See |:help colo| for more information.

versions.release_notes: I've changed the fileformat to unix to prevent ^M errors.
Some colors have been tweaked for more pleasant vimming on LCD screens and dark CRTs.  I've added a few highlight types to pick up some syntax types I hadn't used before.
